findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the `Coin98 Staking` protocol, there is a special administrative account, i.e., `owner`. This `owner` account plays a critical role in governing and regulating the system-wide operations.

findings.title: Improper Update Of totalStaked
findings.description: In the `Coin98Stake` contract, there is a public variable `totalStaked`, which is used to record the total amount of `C98` tokens staked in the contract. The `unstake()` function does not update the `totalStaked` properly.

findings.title: Improper maxStaked Enforcement in stake()
findings.description: The check of totalStaked is before the update of totalStaked, so it's possible for totalStaked to exceed maxStaked after passing the check.

findings.title: Improved Sanity Checks For System Parameters
findings.description: DeFi protocols typically have a number of system-wide parameters that can be dynamically configured on demand. The `Coin98 Staking` protocol is no exception.

findings.title: Potential Less Profit From Permissionless unstake()
findings.description: The `unstake()` function is permissionless, which can be invoked by anyone, potentially leading to users gaining less profits if redeemed earlier than expected.
